title: Sony WH-1000XM4 — Like New (Black)

listingInfo.title: Sony WH-1000XM4 Wireless Headphones — Like New
listingInfo.attributes: Color Black, Bluetooth, Noise Cancelling, compatible with iPhone/Android

complaint: Missing USB-C cable after delivery; listing didn’t claim full set.

chatLog.text: Hi! Are the headphones still available?
Yes, still available. Barely used, almost new.
Are they working fine? Bluetooth and noise cancelling okay?
Everything works perfectly. Battery’s still strong.
Okay. Do they come with any pouch or accessories?
Comes with the pouch shown in the photo, no box.
Got it. Can do NT$4,000?
Sure, deal.
Ship via 7-ELEVEN COD, I’ll pay the 60 TWD fee.
Okay, what store should I send it to?
7-ELEVEN Nanjing East (Zhongshan).
Great, I’ll ship tomorrow.
Order created (Order ID: TW-12033).
Seller shipped via 7-ELEVEN.
Arrived at pickup store (Nanjing East).
Picked up & paid COD (NT$4,060). Thanks!

Just received the item — works fine, but no USB-C charging cable.
Listing and chat didn’t mention it’s missing, so I assumed it came with everything.
I’d like to return it for a full refund.
I only sold what’s in the photos. I used the cable for my phone so didn’t include it — thought everyone has one anyway.
I see, but the original box usually includes one.

Dispute logged.
→ Reviewing listing & chat: no claim of “complete accessories.”
→ Official Sony package includes a USB-C cable, but Buyer did not ask specifically.
→ Preliminary finding: No clear fault (Neutral SNAD – lack of clarity on both sides).

Suggested resolution:
A) Return & Full Refund (Buyer covers 60 TWD shipping)
OR
B) Keep item and negotiate a small discount (~5–10% = 200–400 TWD).
Okay, if that’s the case, I’ll keep it — how about a 300 TWD refund?
Sure, I’ll refund 300 TWD to you.
Agreement confirmed. Dispute closed – partial refund (NT$300).
